entries.title: Russian Offensive Campaign Assessment, June 20, 2024
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin launched a major information operation during his recent visit to North Korea and Vietnam on June 18 and 19 aimed at sabotaging efforts by Ukraine's partners to clearly define a common strategic objective and...

entries.title: Iran Update, June 20, 2024
entries.description: The Iraqi Resistance Coordination Committee issued a statement suggesting a consensus among Iranian-backed Iraqi militias to resume attacks targeting US forces. This is its first coordinated statement since attacks on US forces paused in January...

entries.title: Africa File, June 20, 2024: Africa Crucial to IS Global Network; Burkinabe Junta Faces Coup Risk
entries.description: The reported presence of multiple high-level leaders in Somalia and across Africa reflects Africa’s increasingly focal role in the IS global network.

entries.title: Russian Offensive Campaign Assessment, June 19, 2024
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un signed a comprehensive strategic partnership agreement in Pyongyang on June 19, likely aimed in part to use military-technical cooperation with North Korea as a threat against...

entries.title: Iran Update, June 19, 2024
entries.description: Hamas is preserving its forces in Rafah rather than engaging the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), likely because Hamas does not believe Israel’s Rafah operation will be decisive.

entries.title: Russian Offensive Campaign Assessment, June 18, 2024
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin published an article in North Korean state-owned newspaper Rodong Sinmun praising Russian–North Korean cooperation on the eve of his visit to North Korea, likely to frame any future support that North Korea will...

entries.title: Iran Update, June 18, 2024
entries.description: A senior Israeli negotiator told Agence France-Presse on June 17 that Hamas still holds “dozens” of living hostages in the Gaza Strip. The official said that Hamas — rather than other militias — is holding most of the hostages.

entries.title: Tom Thacker
entries.description: Tom Thacker is an ArcGIS Geospatial Researcher at the Institute for the Study of War. Tom graduated from the University of Cape Town with an MSc in Conservation Biology before moving to Washington to join ISW as a Geospatial Intelligence intern. He...

entries.title: Russian Offensive Campaign Assessment, June 17, 2024
entries.description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg stated that NATO may take steps to enhance NATO's nuclear deterrence, eliciting varying responses from senior Kremlin officials.

entries.title: Iran Update, June 17, 2024
entries.description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said on June 17 that it has dismantled about half of Hamas’ forces in Rafah. The IDF 162nd Division advanced into Rafah on May 7 and the IDF said that it now controls approximately 60 to 70 percent of the...
